version_description:
- Support for 12 hour am/pm display on the solar wheel
- Nautical and astronomical twilights are rendered on the solar wheel
- Various improvements and bugfixes
- fixes a small bug which prevented some dates from being displayed correctly on smaller devices

- fixes a bug where the weather information was not correctly displayed after switching cities (thank you Leander for reporting)
- adds a simple way to send feedback.
You can now use SolarWatch on your Apple Watch. There is even a complication for the Infograph face on Apple Watch Series 4!

- fixes a crash on older watches
- fixes a bug where golden hour was not available in some cases
This update introduces alarms based on solar events, which was the most requested feature. Also introducing German and Spanish localizations.
Improved reliability of alarms

- hourly weather forecast for the next 48 hours instead of 24.
- new Watch complications: Bezel and Rectangular for Graphic Face on Apple Watch Series 4
- various improvements and bug fixes
- Improvements to German and Spanish localizations.
We listened to your feedback and polished the app on various devices from Watch to iPad. The layout glitches should be all gone and everything much better for languages with long words like German.
This update fixes the small layout bug on the iPhone which was introduced by the iPad layout improvements in the last update.
SolarWatch now has a Widget for the Search Screen on your iPhone.
This update brings iOS 13 support including Dark Mode.

This update introduces the option to compute true sunrise sunset times based on when the sun is above the surrounding terrain. This is especially important in mountainous regions and valleys. Try searching for "Pr√© di Ledro" in the app and have a moment of sympathy for the fine people living in this village in the Italian Alps.
This update fixes a crash in one of the SolarWatch complications for watchOS.
Now you can set alarms up to 12 hours before the actual solar event time.
This update improves the contrast of the Solar Wheel and fixes two rare crashes.

Introducing SolarWatch 1.14 with iOS 14 Widgets! Add a SolarWatch Widget on your home screen and the your favorite locations are just a glance away!

This update also comes with full French and Italian support in SolarWatch.
This update fixes a rare crash and fixes localization errors.
This version introduces a new complication that only shows the next sunrise/sunset time on the Watch.

This update contains numerous fixes and improvements. The most important being the correct display of all night days north of the polar circle on the widgets. The gloomy nights are back. But look at the bright side: just a little more than a month left until the days start getting longer again in the northern hemisphere!

Happy Winter Solstice if you're north of the equator and happy Summer Solstice if you're in the south! 
This update displays the difference of day and night compared to yesterday. It also fixes a pesky but where some times were not fully on 40mm Watches.
This update fixes the display of 12/24 hour time display on circular Watch complications.
This update fixes a crash when enabling terrain based sunrise sunset times.
This update adds Japanese localization and improves German, French, Spanish and Italian localizations. It also fixes the sorting of favorite locations and a few rare crashes.
This update fixes an occasional bug where the app could not get a location fix at launch. The watch complications are also show data more accurately for your current location.

Thanks for your feedback. This update comes with some of the most requested features:
- Select which events are shown on Watch complications
- Change the displayed date on the Watch app
- Fixes occasionally missing location both on the Watch app and the iOS app
This update fixes the ordering of times in the Graphic Bezel Complication.
